description:
A loop hike mostly through the forest on old roads. The only scenic spot is 
at the lookout and the best view point is about to become inaccessible. Due 
to recent events at lookouts around the province, the residential area is 
being fenced off with cameras added for security.  Hence this will eliminate 
access to the best view point. 
Starting with Whiskey Jack Trail head east to connect with Fire lookout 
road. Past the Lookout continue down to the creek and eventually connect 
with Hydro Line trails that head to Elk Pass. We followed the Hydo line 
mostly from Elk Lakes parking back to Bolton Creek but missed one turn 
and ended up next to the road for about 300 meters.
This would probably make a better ski trip than hike. There were a few 
bikers on the trail too. There is one creek crossing where you may get wet.
directions:
Peter Lougheed Provincial Park - west of Calgary about 50-60km to Hiway 
#40 going South (Kananaskis Trail).  Drive South on #40 for 50km to park 
entry.  Follow road until you see parking lot for Bolton Creek Trading post. 
Trail starts behind the trading post. 
Start on paved trail. Head east to Whiskey Jack trail.
title: Kananaskis Fire Lookout loop from Bolton Creek
